metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11360 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description: A buffer overflow in iptables-restore in netfilter iptables 1.8.2 allows an attacker to (at least) crash the program or potentially gain code execution via a specially crafted iptables-save file. This is related to add_param_to_argv in xshared.c.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> To exploit this, you would need to trick someone into restoring a set of iptables rules from a malicious iptables-save file. This is quite an unlikely scenario. Reproducer doesn't work on xenial and bionic, like an issue in 1.8.2 only.

criterions.comment: iptables: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
